title: The Reckoning Tribunal
outcome: The Council launches a televised tribunal to address BCI abuses, putting officials and algorithm designers under public scrutiny. Oksana Lintz becomes a reluctant public witness as citizens demand real accountability and reparations, while the Innovators divert blame toward outdated BCI subsystems. The tribunal brings visible order, but leaves simmering resentment and unresolved guilt.

events.description: The Council announces a citywide tribunal investigating BCI injustices; past and current administrators are summoned for testimony, all sessions broadcast live.
Oksana Lintz testifies, revealing the pressure to suppress BCI errors since 2023. Her public confession divides opinion; some see her as a whistleblower, others as complicit.
Innovator-aligned Council members blame failures on legacy BCI subsystems and pilot-era policies, shifting focus from current leadership. Tribunal issues public statements of 'remedial intent.'
The first public reparations are promised to those wrongly sanctioned, but implementation details remain unclear. Citizens are skeptical, and protests subside, but widespread distrust lingers.
